poem:
"Blood's Betrayal"

Roses offered, scarlet promises,
on the tongue, a hint of iron.
In the veins of the suffering,
a symphony of mistakes echoes.
The health-giver turned executioner,
ritual of healing spun awry.
Across the crimson river under skin,
dances the specter of betrayal.
So much depends upon trust -
now stolen, with only silence reigning.
Innocence and lives, profaned
by an unseen hand of error.
